page.title: 02History-1086 On.Whiteparish
page.content: There has been a settlement here since ancient times.Mesolithic flints,Bronze -age barrows found nearby. Present landscape traceable to late Roman era. In 1086,{Frustfield}and{Cowsfield}were mentioned and Whiteparish evolved from these two Saxon centres.The church was built in 1190,mainly of flint and chalk.The name of the parish then changed to{Whitechurch}and finally {Whiteparish.}Two possibly 14th. cent. windmills in Cowsfield exist now as mounds.{Agricultural land}in acres:- 1000 in 1086;2800 in 1350;3600 by 1700.The{BLACK DEATH}:-only 3 freemen escaped in{Cowsfield Louveras}in 1349. By the 17th.Cent.the various small settlements had decreased in favour of Whiteparish.After 1610 four farms appeared in Cowsfield.One,{MORRIS HOLT {FARM,}was visited & is described on page 3.{Present population approx.1000
